website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser IE 800 is the most expensive non-custom-molded in-canal earphone pair we've reviewed, and it earns its price with excellent audio performance.
pros: Superb audio performance through the frequency range, with rich lows and clear, vibrant mids and highs
Thoughtfully designed ear tips are easy to swap out, clean
Protective filters keep outside elements away from drivers
cons: Cable is not fully detachableâhardwired to ear pieces

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser IE800 Audiophile IEM's
customer_reviews.text: Just received the IE800's - all I can say having tried the Shure SE535's, these are in a completely different league in every way. Simply stunning clarity, bass & detail for such tiny IEM's - almost defy physics they are that good. Excellent guarantee & build quality as they are made of ceramic , not the cheap plastic offered by others
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good For IPhone 6+ and probably earlier I phones.
customer_reviews.text: These very expensive earphones are definately an improvement on the generic iPhone earbuds but the generic iphone buds are also much better than you ever read in reviews. Some reviewers said that these earphones need a better source than an iPhone, that is not true. Some people say these need an amplifier. I tried that but it was not necessary. If you can afford the best, these are worth it but don't get conned by fakes. Only buy an unopened box and verify the code on the box with Sennieser website. My new iPhone 6+ seems to have a better DAC than the 6, maybe I had a duff one with that.
customer_reviews.author: Selwyn

customer_reviews.title: Clean base
customer_reviews.text: great clean sound at all volumes with a slight weakness in the mid region. easy to lose the buds and impossible to get replacements. it took over 2 weeks to be able to take them off while alone.
customer_reviews.author: loluis youri

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know where to buy a genuine IE800 except maybe directly from Sennheiser
customer_reviews.text: Bought twice and was disappointed twice. First received a fake copy with plastic shrink wrap and no seals on the box. They have very bad build quality and there is no way you can think they are real. The second order I received a box. You are right, a box with no headphones inside. It’s a joke. I may be forced to get a Shure instead!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: They Sound like you are wearing high end over the ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: Until I purchased the Sennheiser IE 800s I was using Shure SE-535s. I thought the Shure’s were good sounding, but these are even better. Expensive yes, but they sound like a $1,000+ pair of over the ear headphones driven by a good headphone amp. I don’t see how they get the sound quality out of something so small.
customer_reviews.author: Rendell C. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Please be careful when purchasing, FAKE SENNHEISER IE800
customer_reviews.text: Fake IE800 SENNHEISER, I couldn't believe it but if you do a quick google search this is very common!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Completely 100% awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Completely 100% awesome! Sound = 10 Comfort = 10 Everything = 10 Better than anything I have ever heard. Still can't understand how these little things produce such big sound. Bass is very good, everything just sounds great. I have no problems with cable length I can put my iPhone in my pocket and still have plenty of slack. I also hear zero sound from the cables like others have said. These are very small and compact so easy for travel with no extra accessories to carry around. Make sure if you use Spotify to change the sound quality to "extreme" for the best streaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: mysquarepants

customer_reviews.title: ... now and can confidently say these are absolutely the finest sounding headphones I have ever listened to
customer_reviews.text: I've been auditioning these IEM headphones for several weeks now and can confidently say these are absolutely the finest sounding headphones I have ever listened to. They are pricey for sure, but if you want German made quality, you have to pay for it. There have been more than a few complaints about the cable length, but I find it to be well suited to my needs. If a cable is too long, it can get snagged when/where you least expect and cause other problems/damage. I could not be happier with my selection. These are wonderful sounding earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: G. Goddard

customer_reviews.title: High price, but fantastic sound.
customer_reviews.text: These are my first high fidelity headphones and I had to rely only on reviews for the selection. The range and separation of the sound was much better than I expected. The cable and ear pieces are of exceptional quality (although seeing the left and right marks are tuff). If you want to offer your ears the best possible portable sound, it’s hard to imagine there’s anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Earphone review
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife who was listening to her I Phone with the supplied ear buds. She is now transfixed by the aural enhancement and the dynamic range expansion these ear phones exhibit. A wonderful product
customer_reviews.author: John N.

customer_reviews.title: I have never been comfortable with in-ear phones
customer_reviews.text: I have never been comfortable with in-ear phones, but these really are comfortable. I am still learning how to tune my Walkman to work best with these, but they seem otohave very good sound, give a sense of space, and are both easy to use and resistant to wire-snarling. I'm very pleased, and can't wait to travel with them, which is what I bought them for. I am an amateur violist and chamber-music fanatic; SOUND quality in classical music is what I look for, and so far, these deliver - though they do tend to make poor recordings sound poor!
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Very very good portable buds, with very good potential if you want to invest on amps. Solid build, solid sound.
customer_reviews.author: tomoyaqxn

customer_reviews.title: I made a mistake on returning these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I was stupid for returning these over the Shure se846. These are in every way better than the Shure se846 and have WAY BETTER SOUND QUALITY. I'll be buying these again FOR CERTAN.
customer_reviews.author: angel of power

customer_reviews.title: brilliant headphones
customer_reviews.text: In general, they are brilliant headphones. yet they need to burn a few hours before can fully perform their ability.
customer_reviews.author: xin.xie

customer_reviews.title: Bad build quality
customer_reviews.text: A piece fell apart just after using the headphones for just one day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound all across the spectrum
customer_reviews.text: Addicting. Fantastic sound all across the spectrum, very musical, fun and ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: ALY

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: I am an earbud snob, so always willing to try the next great pair. Bought these as a present for my partner and immediately wanted a pair of my own. Great sound. Very comfortable fit. Durable and non tangling cord. Only complaint is cord length - could be a few inches longer so I have some extra slack when on my iPad.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure where Senn comes up with such a high price for these IEM's. I guess it's what the market will bear. Their sound surely doesn't justify a $600+ price tag to my ears. I've listened to a few $150 phones that kill these. Shop around before wasting your cash, a much better value may be found regardless of the mostly stellar? reviews IMO, i.e. Focal Sphear's gen. 1. Incredibly overrated.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Q.

customer_reviews.title: I find that these have very good in sound quality
customer_reviews.text: My hearing is changeable. I find that these do have very good sound quality. The upper range is detailed without being too harsh. Finding the right cushions took a while for me to figure out, and the chords are really too short. I have used the Cardas Clarfier after a while of constant use. Seems to bring the detail back. A bit pricey, was wondering about the new Cardas A8's. Have the older ones Cardas made. I can wear those for quite a while on a plane and not feel that my ears are fatigued.
customer_reviews.author: raymond riddle

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: These are so good and amazingly small and comfortable. I've owned a number of in ear headphones before and fit has always been problematic. These were perfect right away with the standard ear piece. The sound is simply amazing. I've been using Tidal HiFi or my own Apple Lossless files along with an NAD D1050 DAC. And that's really the only issue - the price of these phones is justified but really only if you have a fantastic audio source. I'm really looking forward to my Pono Player!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: great sound, built quality
customer_reviews.text: great sound,built quality,is very flimsy,and break easily Sennheiser repair service is a total ripoff
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Spille

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are unbelievable. Priced that way, too, but, I really enjoy them. At a completely flat setting (no bass boost) they are perfect. Not noise cancelling, so be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: soundguy

customer_reviews.title: The sound is great - it brings feel pitch of quality very well
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great - it brings feel pitch of quality very well. Thus it brings details so clear. I like it very much. Before I say I love it, I have to say it makes me a little bit not comfortable to wear the in-ear buds - yes, there are another 5 pairs of replacements of buds, but I found only the smallest one works well with my ears. And after a long wear, I can't say it is comfortable. Is this something for Sennheiser to improve, or it is common for in-ear headphones? I'm not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser ie800
customer_reviews.text: I never usually write reviews but felt I had to with these. They are stunning, the sound quality is jaw dropping. I also own the Shure se846 but I'm really struggling to get a decent seal with any tips I've tried with them. Not so with the ie800. I would recommend a shirt clip with them to eliminate the cable rub and feel at the price they cost Sennheiser should have included one.
customer_reviews.author: dennis

customer_reviews.title: A HUBBLE TELESCOPE INTO SOUND!!
customer_reviews.text: ASTONISING!! A clear view into the music. Sadly the tips don't seal within the ears. Hopefully S will address this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Moshe D. Shualy

customer_reviews.title: i love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: i love these headphones, they sound better than Shure SE846, but i cant seem to get a good fit in my ears, so if they fit your ears and stay in then they are a keeper. i just wished they made these headphones in a around the back ear style and id be all in. i guess i have to keep using my SE846
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: $800?  Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Best! Treat your ears if you can afford it. And after owning this for about a year, here's what I have to add. It still the best sound, but because this was probably designed pre-iPhone, if you happen to drop the phone with the earbuds in your ears a few times, the cable will get stressed and you'll have to send them back to Sennheiser. Solution? Pull out your old iPod Nano and no more damaged cable. (ps, these can also get lost easily, ouch, I replaced one already!)
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Nee

customer_reviews.title: If you love well balanced sound, this is by far the best
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through many headphone, both in ear and covered. These are by far the most satisfying headphones in terms of sound quality, utility and overall ease of use. I have a pair of Sennheiser HD800 over the ear headphones, to get the best sound out of those $1500 cans, I have to use a decent headphone amp. Needless to say the combination isn't very portable. The IE800 is small and requires no amp to get fantastic sound, dare I say comparable to HD800s. True luxury!
customer_reviews.author: Victor H.

customer_reviews.title: Great bass, good high frequency.
customer_reviews.text: Really takes time to make it "mature". At first the sound was really stiff and terrible, but slowly but gradually it started to improve exponentially, every time it's plugged in and starts to oscillate my eardrum and my heart as well.
customer_reviews.author: David Chan

customer_reviews.title: They're also the best sounding, but not by much in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: These are the most expensive earphones I've owned. They're also the best sounding, but not by much in my opinion. I actually returned my pair because I felt for the price I payed ($800) they were not worth it. I'm still going to give them 5 stars though, because if you're thinking of buying these, money shouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser IE 800 Audiophile ear phones
customer_reviews.text: The best in-ear head phones you can buy and they sound like it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori L. Latta

customer_reviews.title: Worth it?
customer_reviews.text: Incredible earbuds, natural detail, huge soundstage, better than the dark colored HD 600's. Worth it? Well, for $40 you can get the excellent Sennheiser CX 400's; ridiculously good for the price. But if you can afford the IE800's, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Sterny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent earphones
customer_reviews.text: I had IE80 but this pair of earphones is much more gorgeous than my previous one. If you're considering upgrade your earphones, don't hesitate, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Ciel Huang

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best earphone. Let me hear the music I never heard before. Don't want to take off.
customer_reviews.author: Jieke Miao

customer_reviews.title: The Advanced Technology Works
customer_reviews.text: Superb clarity. Much better than Shure IEMs. Would benefit from a clip to attach to shirt and diminish cable movement.
customer_reviews.author: MVW

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely AMAZING. Perfect in every regard and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: No words to describe what a phenomenal work of art & engineering these are. Absolutely AMAZING. Perfect in every regard and worth every penny. Hand-made by God himself in Heaven! Really bravo Sennheiser. Phenomenal! Flawless!
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better wear design
customer_reviews.text: Having a rope around your neck, or stethoscope effect, I have to choose one. All earbuds should learn from Sony's wear design.
customer_reviews.author: Zhihao Yuan

customer_reviews.title: Normally I don't write review unless something very disturbs me ...
customer_reviews.text: Normally I don't write review unless something very disturbs me. The earbuds' design is a completely disaster, it keep's falling out my ear constantly. I have tried every single size of the ear adapter they provides, but none of them fit my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: that is fine, it is not hard to use and the performence is great, I think it is a good product
customer_reviews.text: that is fine, it is not hard to use and the performence is great, I think it is a good product
customer_reviews.author: Zhang Chihao

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and very good seller
customer_reviews.text: The goods is delivery very soon, and the IE800 has good sound and good quality, I will recommend other user how like high quality sound to buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. It preform smooth sound for you. Nice one!
customer_reviews.author: JackyGuo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent effects
customer_reviews.text: Very good earphones. If it has mic that will be better.
customer_reviews.author: BrettQ

customer_reviews.title: Great IEM
customer_reviews.text: I auditioned these for several weeks and ultimately returned them. The sound is excellent. Clear and true. But I prefer a slightly more nuanced signature.
customer_reviews.author: Amafortas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: sorry i really can not pick out the difference between this and my beats. maybe i am deaf
customer_reviews.author: No name

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the headphones used - unfortunately some of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the headphones used - unfortunately some of the parts were missing . I had to listen to the headphones w/o the black rubber ear tips . There was a considerable loss of bass w/o the rubber ear tips .
customer_reviews.author: lwm

customer_reviews.title: ie80s were good to start with
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded these from ie80 and the difference is night and day.. ie80s were good to start with, but these are just on another level. So crisp and clear detailed in sound. Slightly high on bass though but i actually like it that way. I cant put these down amazing sound and comfort. If u truley love your music and have that extra cash just go with the ie800. You wont regret.
customer_reviews.author: thegreat1

product_meta.title: Sennheiser IE 800 Audiophile Ear Canal Headphones
product_meta.description: The IE 800 establishes a new audio performance benchmark for dynamic driver ear canal headphones. A newly developed extra wide band (XWB) transducer, flaunting a diameter of only 7 mm, is currently smallest extra wide band sound transducer available in dynamic ear canal phones. This transducer delivers dynamic, high output, distortion-free performance when housed in Sennheiser's state-of-the-art dampened two chamber absorbers (D2CA) ceramic housing. Designed, developed and produced in Germany, the IE 800 boasts innovative technology packed in an attractive, modern and elegant design. Manufactured with high-quality materials, such as scratch-resistant ceramic for the housing to ensure longevity, these ear-canal phones make enjoying audiophile music "on-the-go" a reality. They are the perfect companion to any portable audio device, especially those capable of delivering high resolution sound.
feature_bullets: Dynamic linear-phase 7mm transducer delivers extremely wide frequency response (8-41,000 Hz (-3 dB), 5-46,500 Hz (-10 dB)).Connectivity Technology: Wired
The precision ceramic housing features attenuated dual-chamber absorber (D2CA) to deliver extremely low harmonic distortion even at high output levels (< 0.06% (1 kHz, 94 dB)).
Ergonomic, oval-shaped ear adaptors for maximum comfort.
